articles.title: DPRK Delegation Arrives in New York
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Arrives in New York
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Ri Su Yong, minister of Foreign Affairs, arrived in New York on Wednesday to participate in the 70th UN General Assembly.

articles.title: CPRK Secretariat Slams S. Korean Warmongers' Military Provocation against DPRK
articles.content:
CPRK Secretariat Slams S. Korean Warmongers' Military Provocation against DPRK
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The special warfare commander of the south Korean puppet Army in a report at the "National Assembly" on Sept. 23 said that they are pushing forward the "formation of a special unit for striking north's nuclear facilities and other major strategic military facilities", adding they would form a new air force unit for "ensuring promptness of operation for special unit's infiltration".
					 Military warmongers of south Korea are fanning up a war fever for invading the north, talking about "maximization of efficiency of special operation in contingency" and "examination of manufacturing of offensive drones for striking targets in the whole are of the north".
					
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in its information bulletin No. 1101 on Thursday termed this an open military provocation to drive the inter-Korean relations into a catastrophe again by going against the trend of the situation where they narrowly weathered a hair-trigger crisis. The information bulletin went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are vociferating about "confidence", "reunion of separated families" and "talks between authorities" but prodding military gangsters into cooking up war scenarios to do harm to fellow countrymen. This is the height of provocations.
					
					 This proves again that the "confidence-building" and "peaceful unification" touted by the south Korean authorities is nothing but a charade.
					
					 The south Korean puppet military gangsters are trying to strike the nuclear treasured sword of the DPRK firmly defending peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula from the ever more increasing danger of a nuclear war by the U.S. and its followers. This is as foolish self-destructive act as jumping into fire with faggot on their back.
					
					 We value dialogue and peace but will never pardon provokers running wild without discretion to strike our inviolable war deterrence and will mete out merciless punishment to them by dint of Songun.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Jose Mario Vaz, president of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, on Thursday on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Guinea-Bissau would steadily develop in the future, too, wishing the president of Guinea-Bissau success in his noble work for national reconciliation and the country's stability and socio-economic development.

articles.title: Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair
articles.content:
Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The 11th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here on September 21-24.
					 Attending it were more than 300 firms from 16 countries and one region, including the DPRK, New Zealand, Germany, Romania, Russia and Malaysia.
					
					 Presented to the fair were electronic, machine, metal, building, medical and light industrial products, foodstuffs and consumer goods.
					
					 O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of External Economic Relations of the DPRK, told KCNA that the fair offered an important opportunity in strengthening the friendship and economic relations among countries.
					
					 The DPRK will further expand the economic relations with other countries and develop in a sustained way the bilateral and multilateral cooperation in trade, investment, finance and other fields, he said.
					
					 Pak Ung Sik, director of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, expressed the will to contribute to promoting the economic development through fair.
					
					 Damon Lee, an official of Singapore's Kee Wee Hup Kee Food Manufacture Ltd., said that they hope to make use of Pyongyang fairs to introduce their products as well as many other Asian delicacies.

articles.title: Diplomatic Corps Here Visits Farm No. 1116
articles.content:
Diplomatic Corps Here Visits Farm No. 1116
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The diplomatic corps here visited Farm No. 1116 on Thursday.
					 They went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history, mushroom farm and other places, being briefed on the farm contributing to studying and developing high-yielding crops suited to the climate and natural features of Korea.
					
					 They were impressed by the achievements being made by agricultural workers there in producing high-yielding and nutritious crops.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition of Architecture and Portraits Opens
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition of Architecture and Portraits Opens
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition of architecture and portraits opened at the Chollima Hall of Culture Thursday under the co-sponsorship of the Korean Cities Federation and the Koryo Studio.
					 Displayed there were two and three dimensional photos of buildings, landscapes and personages of the DPRK and other countries.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, working people in Pyongyang, Nicholas Bonner, director of the Koryo Studio, and his party, staff members of foreign embassies here and foreign guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The participants looked round the photos on display.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Coal Industry Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Coal Industry Held
Unsan, September 24 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of coal industry took place at the Chonsong Youth Coal Mine on Wednesday and Thursday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers, field officials and the three-revolution team members of the units under the State Academy of Sciences, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Phyongsong University of Coal Mining, the Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex, the Anju Area Coal Mining Complex and other units.
					
					 Its participants heard more than 140 valuable papers conducive to solving the scientific and technological issues arising in developing the coal industry.
					
					 There was a scientific and technological exchange for exploiting more coal resources during the presentation.

articles.title: Workshop for Cultivation of Greenhouse Vegetables Given
articles.content:
Workshop for Cultivation of Greenhouse Vegetables Given
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A workshop for cultivation of greenhouse vegetables took place at the Pyongyang Agency for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries from Sept. 21 to 24 under the co-sponsorship of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Polish embassy here.
					 Present there were officials, researchers and technicians in the field of agricultural science.
					
					 There were lectures given by Polish experts in cultivation of greenhouse vegetables.
					
					 Dealt with there were scientific and technical issues arising in increasing production of greenhouse vegetables in keeping with the world trend of development.
					
					 During the workshop, members of the Polish embassy and Polish experts visited the Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District and the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science.

articles.title: Japan's "Security Legislation" Is War Law: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's "Security Legislation" Is War Law: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday carries a commentary denouncing Japan for railroading the security bills through the session of the House of Councilors to make it a law.
					 This vividly proves that Japan's militarist hysteria reached the extremes as it is a blatant challenge to the public at home and abroad desirous of peace, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The Japanese ruling quarters enacted the law while extending the term of the present Diet. Lurking behind this is their ultimate design to realize without fail the old dream of dominating the world which they dreamt during the period of Empire while crying out for "oriental peace".
					
					 The "security legislation" is a war law legalizing Japan's military aggression overseas in the light of its nature and contents.
					
					 It would help Japan conduct military operations anywhere in the world and dispatch its "Self-Defense Forces" overseas anytime under the pretext of safeguarding its peace and security and supporting the U.S. forces. Japan can nullify any moment article 9 of its Constitution which stipulates its permanent abandonment of war and exercise of armed forces.
					
					 This brought to light the nature of Japan as a war state refusing to redeem its past crimes and dreaming of conquering the world though seven decades have passed since its defeat.
					
					 Militarist Japan with vaulting ambition for reinvasion is sadly mistaken.
					
					 Japan, which deceived humankind with crocodile tears after its defeat, is working hard to revenge it. This will lead Japan to another defeat of self-destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Remarks about "Human Rights" Denounced by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Remarks about "Human Rights" Denounced by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website an article disclosing the south Korean authorities' talk about "human rights" on September 10.
					 The article said that the committee was compelled to reveal the present human rights situation in south Korea upon the south Korean chief executive's rhetoric about the "human rights".
					
					 Early in her office she cried out for the commitment to "human rights."
					
					 But they have all disappeared.
					
					 The article said that the people's livelihood was deteriorated because of the pro-plutocrats policy, tax reduction for the rich, etc.

articles.title: S. Korean Bodies Call for Launching Actions against Regime
articles.content:
S. Korean Bodies Call for Launching Actions against Regime
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- At least 50 organizations of south Korea including the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Peasants Associations held a press conference at the conference room of the confederation on Sept. 22 where they formed the headquarters for all-people actions.
					 Speakers deplored plutocrats getting fat whereas millions of workers not receiving minimum wages.
					
					 Moreover, the security and vital right of the people are seriously threatened in the agricultural, educational and other fields, they said.
					
					 They called for joining in such actions as voting against evil labor law and a signature campaign for opposing rice import.
					
					 On Sept. 19, core members of the Confederation of Trade Unions and its affiliated organizations and 7 000 trade unionists held a rally in Seoul at which they declared they would fight against the authorities' policy against workers.

articles.title: S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Accused of Moving to Adopt "Bill on Human Rights in North"
articles.content:
S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Accused of Moving to Adopt "Bill on Human Rights in North"
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The "Saenuri Party" and other tricksters of south Korea have recently worked hard to pass the confrontational "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly".
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party in a statement Thursday terms this a foul coalition among south Korean political charlatans to enact an evil law aimed at escalating confrontation between the north and the south and perpetuating the national division for partisan strategy and maintenance of power.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" is not entitled to talk about human rights, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The history from Syngman Rhee's "Liberal Party" to the present "Saenuri Party" is stained with heinous human rights abuses in which independence and democracy of the society and vital rights of south Koreans have been mangled at the bayonets of the fascist dictatorship.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" is the group of pro-U.S. sycophants and wicked traitors and political profiteers kowtowing to their American master, not making a protest word against the horrible human rights abuses such as murder, robbery, rape and plunder committed by the U.S. imperialist aggressors in south Korea while only making wrongdoings in the world such as scandals and sexual assaults.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" had better pay attention to putting under control the south Korean society which turned into the world's worst human rights tundra by its unpopular misrule, far from caring for maintaining the dictatorial power and squandering money collected from the people as taxes. This would help it save its face.
					
					 The statement urged the opposition party of south Korea advertising "democracy" and "unification" not to align with the traitorous party, headquarters of fascist dictatorship, and anti-reunification forces and go against the public mindset but judge the situation with cool head and behave with reason.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities Accused of Passing War Bills
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities Accused of Passing War Bills
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The passage of the security bills has sparked off strong protest in Japan as they are posing serious threats to global peace and stability.
					 Statements are being released and demos waged in different parts of Japan in protest against the railroading of the war bills by the government and the ruling party.
					
					 Scholars representing at least 14 000 researchers of 148 universities held an emergency press conference and made public a statement.
					
					 Protest actions are running high outside the Diet building in Tokyo and in other major cities.
					
					 Meanwhile, the opinion poll conducted after the passage of the bills showed that the support rate for the Cabinet dropped sharply.
					
					 Opposition parties said they would push forward joint solidarity against the regime with the election of the House of Councilors due next July as a momentum.

articles.title: Japan's Passage of Security Bills Censured by S. Korean Paper
articles.content:
Japan's Passage of Security Bills Censured by S. Korean Paper
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Minjok Ilbo, an internet paper of south Korea, in an editorial titled "Passage of security bills, signal for revival of Japanese militarism and reinvasion" on Sept. 21 recalled that the security bills pursuant to the new "Japan-U.S. defense cooperation  guidelines" were passed through the session of the House of Councilors.
					 The passage of the bills provided Japan with a legal ground for invading other countries and eligibility of fighting a war again, it held.
					
					 Japan railroaded the bills as it is seized by the ambition for militarist reinvasion, it said.
					
					 The bills were railroaded by the U.S. strategy of prodding Japan into containing the north and thus holding hegemony in Northeast Asia and dominating the world, it noted.
					
					 If Japan seeks to realize its ambition for militarist reinvasion by kowtowing to the U.S., it will face unprecedented disastrous ruin, it concluded.

articles.title: DPRK's Birth Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birth Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- There took place diverse events in different countries in celebration of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 A meeting and photo exhibition were held in Sweden, roundtable talks in DR Congo, roundtable talks, book and photo exhibition and film show in Iran on September 6 and 7. 
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and other books and photos showing the efforts of the Korean people to build a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 The Korean film "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity" was screened at the film show. 
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association said the foundation of the DPRK was a historical event which laid a foundation for reunification of Korea and its independence, prosperity, peace and stability. 
					
					 The chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo said the DPRK has firmly maintained the principle of independence in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliance in national defence by fully embodying the Juche idea in all fields of the state activities. 
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Sweden.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked in Syria
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked in Syria
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Syrian TV and radio broadcasting services and newspapers carried special write-ups from September 7 to 9, the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					The Syria TV Channel aired special news together with the portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and videos carrying revolutionary activities of the President and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					It aired pictures showing the invincible might of the Korean People's Army and the efforts of the Korean people for building a thriving socialist nation and conveyed in detail the undying exploits of the great leaders for the foundation of the DPRK and its development and the cause of reunification of Korea. 
					
					The Syrian central radio aired the similar reports. 
					
					The newspaper Al Baath carried an article titled "On 67th founding anniversary of DPRK working hard to defend sovereignty and build a thriving socialist nation." 
					
					The paper detailed how the Korean people enjoy a worthwhile life in the socialist system centered on the popular masses. 
					
					The papers Al Thawrah and Tishrin carried articles praising the exploits of Kim Il Sung for the development of the DPRK shining as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence. 
					
					The paper Al Nour carried an article praising the DPRK, a genuine country for the people fully ensuring all rights and dignity of the people just as its name implies.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Nepal
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was brought out in booklet by the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies the essence of leader Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his whole life characterized by his warm love for the country and the people.
					
					 It also indicates the important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies Denounce S. Korean Authorities for Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies Denounce S. Korean Authorities for Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement in denunciation of the south Korean authorities' anti-DPRK "human rights" racket on September 18. 
					 The joint statement said:
					
					 The conservative and pro-U.S. "Saenuri Party," the ruling party, and the opposition parties of south Korea try to cook up the reactionary "bill on human rights in the north" and railroad it through the "National Assembly" at any cost.
					
					 This is the vicious and criminal politically-motivated provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 The base moves of the NA of south Korea for railroading the "bill on human rights in the north" are timed to coincide with the frantic moves of the U.S. and its followers to launch a new plot against the DPRK over the issue of "human rights" in the UN and international arena.
					
					 The south Korean NA plans mean provocation while talking about "south-north parliamentary talks" and "implementing of agreement." 
					
					 It is the height of impudence to talk about "dialogue" while totally denying and opposing the dialogue partner. 
					
					 The reactionary moves to cook up the "bill on human rights in the north" will drive the north-south relations which have recently been improved into a catastrophe again. 
					
					 The DPRK will not allow the south Korean NA's reactionary and criminal moves to cook up the "bill on human rights in the north" but resolutely cope with them.

articles.title: MINREX de RPDC denuncia "reunion de especialistas" de fuerzas hostiles
articles.content:
MINREX de RPDC denuncia "reunion de especialistas" de fuerzas hostiles
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 23 una declaracion siguiente:
					Las fuerzas hostiles abusan de la escena de derechos humanos de la ONU como patio de complot de "DDHH" anti-RPDC para racionalizar la confabulacion de aplastamiento internacional.
					
					Durante el periodo de la 30a reunion del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU, Estados Unidos y otras fuerzas hostiles convocaron una supuesta "reunion de especialistas" sobre el inexistente "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC, ocasion en la cual crearon el ambiente de condena internacional contra la RPDC acusandola con los datos inventados referidos en el viejo "informe de investigacion" y la "resolucion de DDHH".
					
					Puesto que la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC persigue evidentemente el "cambio de regimen" y la "sustitucion del poder", la RPDC rechazo la misma convocacion de dicha "reunion" y no tuvo la necesidad de tomar parte en esa "reunion".
					
					Pero, ya que el contenido de la "reunion" fue muy provocativo y pasa su limite, la RPDC participo en ella a fin de revelar los verdaderos aspectos de las maniobras intrigantes de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de los enemigos.
					
					Como estaba previsto, la "reunion" volvio a demostrar al mundo su verdadero aspecto del complot politico para "derrumbar el regimen" pretextando los derechos humanos siendo producto de la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. 
					
					Lo que no podemos pasar por alto es que EE.UU., autor de guerra agresiva y caudillo de violacion de DDHH, se puso al frente de la discusion del "problema de DDHH" de alguien, fingiendose como "protector de DDHH".
					
					EE.UU. es el imperio de males que perturba la paz y viola los DDHH no solo en su territorio, sino tambien en otras regiones del planeta.
					
					El es el autor que trajo la actual crisis critica de refugiados que toca a toda la Europa.
					
					Bajo el pretexto de "antiterrorismo" y el establecimiento de "democracia", EE.UU. estallo y promovio las guerras  en Afganistan, Irak, Libia, Siria, etc., lo cual hizo aumentar bruscamente el numero de los refugiados y causar en todos los rincones del mundo las voces de condena al EE.UU. como autor del problema de refugiados.
					
					La reciente "reunion de especialistas" mostro fehacientemente los aspectos pueriles de Japon y los paises de la Union Europea, que se obedecen a ciegas a EE.UU. violando sin vacilacion la soberania del pais determinado.
					
					Lo mas problematico es la conducta injusta del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU.
					
					Al ver el espectaculo anormal en que la mencionada organizacion internacional se usa como espacio de represion contra un pais determinado sumandose a la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. en lugar de cuestionar primero los graves actos de violacion de DDHH, condenados y rechazados por todo el mundo, la RPDC tuvo gran duda y preocupacion sobre los principios de la imparcialidad y neutralidad estricta de que habla el Consejo de los Derechos Humanos de la ONU.
					
					Si se toleran de continuo tales actos, la escena internacional de DDHH no podra servir del patio por el verdadero dialogo y cooperacion, sino se convertira en un campo de confrontacion politica que se utiliza para las relaciones de interes de los paises individuales.
					
					La RPDC mantiene la posicion invariable, segun la cual desea el sincero dialogo y cooperacion para la proteccion y fomento de DDHH, pero rechaza fuertemente el dialogo y cooperacion que persiguen un necio objetivo politico.
					
					La RPDC condena categoricamente la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC como la "reunion de especialistas" calificandola de la imperdonable provocacion politica y redobla la voluntad de enfrentarse con intransigencia a los escandalos de "DDHH" de las fuerzas hostiles.
					
					Sin hacer caso de las maniobras hostiles la RPDC defendera y consolidara el regimen socialista a estilo coreano, solar de vida y felicidad de nuestro pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Guinea-Bissau
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 24 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Guinea-Bissau, Jose Mario Vaz, con motivo del 42o aniversario de proclamacion de esta republica.
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran invariablemente tambien en el futuro, el remitente desea al destinatario exitos en su noble trabajo para la conciliacion nacional, la estabilidad y el desarrollo socio-economico del pais.

articles.title: Exposicion internacional de mercancias de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Exposicion internacional de mercancias de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 21 al 24 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la XI Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang.
					En la feria tomaron parte mas de 300 companias provenientes de casi 20 paises y region incluyendo la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Nueva Zelanda, Alemania, Rumania, Rusia, Malasia y embajadas acreditadas en Corea
					
					En la ocasion se presentaron muchos articulos electronicos, maquinas, productos metalurgicos, medicos, alimentos y articulos de uso diario de industria ligera.
					
					Citado por la ACNC, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, O Ryong Chol dijo que gracias a los esfuerzos sinceros de los participantes, la presente feria sirvio de una oportunidad importante en ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y economia exterior con otros paises.
					
					Dado que se ha fortalecido considerablemente el poderio estatal y el prestigio internacional del pais, la RPDC ampliara mas las relaciones economicas con varios paises y desarrollara constantemente la cooperacion bilateral y multilateral en varios dominios como el negocio, la inversion y la financiacion.
					
					El director de la Agencia de Exposiciones Internacionales de Corea, Pak Ung Sik manifesto su voluntad de contribuir a promover el desarrollo economico de nueva epoca independiente en el futuro tambien a traves de la exposicion.
					
					Damon Lee, oficial de la Compania de Produccion de Alimentos Kee Wee Hup Kee de Singapur, asevero que al participar en esa exposicion recibio una buena impresion. 
					
					Recalco que su colectivo presento en la presente exposicion las frutas conservadas, las comidas secas, los alimentos instantaneos y las meriendas de diversos generos.
					
					Expuso su deseo de tomar parte con frecuencia en las exposiciones que se abren en esta capital y dar a conocer sus productos y los tipicos de Asia.

articles.title: Ley de seguridad de Japon es la de guerra, insiste Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Ley de seguridad de Japon es la de guerra, insiste Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El proyecto de la ley de seguridad de Japon fue aprobado en la reunion de la camara de consejeros.
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual de este jueves, lo califica de desafio frontal a la opinion publica interna y externa aspirante a la paz y de expresion de la extremada locura militarista de Japon. 
					
					Los gobernantes japoneses aprobaron la ley de seguridad prolongando la sesion de la dieta con la meta de lograr a toda costa el sueno de la era del imperio de tomar la hegemonia mundial bajo el pretexto de la "paz del Oriente". 
					
					La ley en cuestion es la de guerra que justifica la agresion militar a ultramar. 
					
					La ley permite a las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" desplegar por doquier del mundo las operaciones militares y enviar a sus efectivos al extranjero bajo el rotulo de defender la paz y la seguridad y apoyar a las tropas norteamericanas. 
					
					Ya es la cuestion del tiempo la invalidacion del articulo IX de la constitucion pacifista de Japon que legalizaba la renuncia eterna de la guerra y el uso de armas. 
					
					De esta manera, se ha revelado la naturaleza de Japon como pais belicoso que persigue conquistar el mundo entero. 
					
					Pero, es irrealizable la ambicion de Japon militarista. 
					
					La nueva agresion de Japon le traera la segunda derrota.
